file_content.text: I'm dying. Blast it, I'm dying.
Leave. Leave me.
You eliminated the cell leaders. Now we must remove every trace of their operation and prevent their followers from regrouping.
The terrorist communications hub--the system they use to arrange meetings, store secrets, broadcast propaganda--must be destroyed. The man at your feet is our opportunity.
He's a person, not an "opportunity."
Have some respect.
You don't believe that any more than I do.
I thought stopping the meeting would end this.
Communications hub?
There are always survivors. Terrorists scattered around Nar Shaddaa. You can deny them the resources to rebuild.
I don't know anything...
He's mewling on the floor. He's barely an opportunity for target practice.
Can't I just kill him?
You can kill him soon, if you like. This won't take long.
We can use his computer-enhanced brain to locate the hub. You'll need to route me to his cortical implant.
What? You can't do that.
There should be a standard interface somewhere on his skull. Connect your holocommunicator and I can slice the data inside his mind.
Please--I'll tell you what you need to know. Just don't slice my brain.
It's nothing personal, but it is necessary.
I'm sorry for doing this.
I don't want to hurt you. Cooperate, and it'll be okay.
Let's talk this through.
The hub--it's in Network Access. The droids protect it.
We can't be sure he's telling the truth.
Grid seven-alpha, module five. Please don't let him into my head.
That's all I needed to hear.
Thank you. [Kill him]
If you can drag yourself out of the building, you can go free.
Get away from here.
I understand. Recording function terminated. You won't see me again.
I'll fix up your wounds--then you need to leave.
Let me help you.
I don't understand... thank you. Recording function terminated.
I won't be a problem again.
Let's hope you haven't made a mistake trusting the word of a terrorist.
Network Access is a maze of computers and HoloNet transceivers. Assuming the hub is there, you should be able to destroy it.
You played the game and lost. These are the consequences.
Shut up and deal with it.
Don't. Please don't. Ah...!
I'm inside. He's Aphel Jaarn. Born on Dantooine. Sixteen years old, he comes to Nar Shaddaa. Works for the Exchange, earns his cybernetics.
Nineteen years. He's recruited by the Nar Shaddaa terror cell. Starts as nothing, but his enhancements prove useful to men higher up.
They connect him to the cell's communications hub. Feed him codes and patterns. Now the coordinates are mine.
Where am I going next?
Tell me.
What am I supposed to do with him now?
What about the cyborg?
Leave him to die. I'm releasing his mind.
Ah. Can't think. Can't....
Yes? And?
The hub is in the Network Access sector--a maze of computers and HoloNet transceivers.
You'll have to pass the cell's security droids to reach it; certainly within your capabilities. Once you're there, disable the terminal.
Then the Nar Shaddaa terror cell will cease to exist.
What--wha? Can't--can't....
Consider this an act of mercy.
Goodbye. [Kill Aphel]
I've got to go--don't drool on the floor too much.
Pathetic.
Don't--don't... don't.
I'll fix up your wounds. Someone will come find you.
Let me help.
Good--good. Bye.
Recording function activated. Self-diagnosis: Critical. I'm going to die. I'm looking at the woman who's going to kill me.
Recording function activated. Self-diagnosis: Critical. I'm going to die. I'm looking at the man who's going to kill me.
A cyborg. How convenient.
You're going to lose. I know you're going to lose.
I don't have anything to say to the likes of you.
